title: Charlton Athletic pay touching tribute to Addicks fan PC Keith Palmer after he was murdered in London terror attack
text:
As an immediate tribute to hero Keith, a red and white scarf has been placed on the seat which he occupied for many years… #cafc pic.twitter.com/iKZkQufC6i 
— Charlton Athletic FC (@CAFCofficial) March 23, 2017 
Charlton Athletic have paid a touching tribute to the heroic police officer who was killed during the London terror attack on Wednesday. 
Diego Simeone reveals how Manchester United can sign Antoine Griezmann this summer PC Keith Palmer, a season ticket holder and loyal supporter of the Addicks, was tragically murdered while on duty outside the Houses of Parliament when an attacker burst in armed with two knives and stabbed him to death at the scene.
The attacker had mowed down pedestrians with a car just minutes earlier on Westminster Bridge before stabbing the 48-year-old.
The husband and father, who had 15 years’ service, was a familiar face at The Valley and he sat in the same East Stand seat for many years.
PC Keith Palmer was tragically killed (Picture: PA) And Charlton have honoured his memory by placing a red and white scarf on his seat, which will remain there until their next home match on Tuesday April 4.
The club are also planning to pay their respects to him during their League One game against Milton Keynes Dons.
A statement from the club read: ‘It is with great sadness that the club has learned of the tragic news of the death of PC Keith Palmer, a loyal Charlton supporter and season-ticket holder, who lost his life as a result of the terror incident in Westminster on Wednesday afternoon.
Charlton have left a scarf on his seat (Picture: Charlton Athletic/Twitter) ‘Keith was a familiar face at The Valley to many supporters and sat in his same East Stand seat for many years.
‘As an immediate tribute, a red and white scarf has been placed on his seat which will remain until the next home game on Tuesday, April 4th, while the club will discuss ways in which it can commemorate his life at the game itself.

‘Keith was a true hero who will be greatly missed by all the Charlton family and everyone at the club would like to offer their sincere condolences to his family and friends at this extremely difficult time.
‘The club also wish to extend condolences to the families of all those victims who were involved in yesterday’s incident.’
